dublin_core.dcvalue: African Copyright and Access to Knowledge (ACA2K) Project

the interviews were collected by experts in the field and The comparative findings presented in this paper are drawn from the eight ACA2K study countries (Egypt, Ghana, Kenya, Morocco, Mozambique, Senegal, South Africa and Uganda) and are based on the eight ACA2K Country Reports
Contact the editors for conditions of access
Tobias Schonwetter, Jeremy de Beer, Dick Kawooya,Achal Prabhala,
The International Development Research Centre (IDRC) The Shuttleworth Foundation

A series of impact assessment interviews were conducted to gather qualitative empirical data. In each study country, researchers engaged a variety of key actors and stakeholders, including representatives from government, the education sector, and rights-holder groups
ACA2K Country Reports, Legal sources , legislation, interviews , expert knowledge
The African Copyright and Access to Knowledge (ACA2K) project research scope
Egypt, Ghana, Kenya, Morocco, Mozambique, Senegal, South Africa, Uganda
